articles.content:
Hospital Workers Union in S. Korea Threatens General Strike 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The National Hospital Workers Union declared on July 2 that it would call a general strike, according to the south Korean CBS.
 Expressing strong dissatisfaction with the hospital management sides which had been insincere towards the collective negotiations, reneging on the agreements made with the union, it threatened to call a general strike on July 8 unless its demand is met by the Central Labor Committee.

Greetings to Malawian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malawian President
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly,  Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Malawian President Bingu Wa Mutarika on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of its independence. 
  Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in mutual interests, the message wished the president and the people of Malawi greater successes in their work for national unity and the prosperity of the country.

Greetings to President of Comoros
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Comoros
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Azali Assumani, president of the Comoros, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the independence of the Comoros.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further develop in scope and wished the president and people of the Comoros greater successes in their work for development and stability of the country.
